ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Practical knowledge about professional research, client relationships, report production, etc.
Self guided research, team work, and how to approach issues and think about problem solving

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Everything about this course! Super helpful and aa great experience overall
Weaknesses: Only meeting once a week was rough (doing a massive amount of work each week and then only formally checking in once). Meeting for one hour twice a week probably would have been more helpful (obviously that would only work for some advisors though...)

Hoping next year there is a little bit more institutional communication from the Jackson Institute! I never received a single email about the capstone as a program, which felt weird to me, and Casey King (who organizes the program) was unresponsive for most of the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. As if you have a choice...

The Capstones change every year, so not super relevant. BUT if Sue teaches again, whatever it is, try to get in her group. The capstone experience is shaped more by the people you are working with and the atmosphere the team creates. Sue created a phenomenal work environment that brought out the best in each person in our six person group. She will make sure everyone is heard and respected, while giving you the autonomy to really make it your own. She is also just the nicest, most supportive professor I have ever had. GET IN SUE'S GROUP.
